abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is highly
            satisfactory, sustainability highly likely, and the
            institutional development impact is high. Performances by
            the Bank, and Borrower are similarly rated as satisfactory,
            and highly satisfactory, respectively. Lessons focus on the
            competency of the Tianjin implementing agencies, which
            delivered high quality, and speed of physical construction
            components, therefore, the high economic rates of return in
            the area, are attributable to such efficient implementation.
            Restructuring under the project, particularly that of the
            public transport company, was mostly beneficial, in that it
            encouraged a results-oriented approach, rather than
            emphasizing on operational, and technical results alone.
            Also, a flexible approach in project design, strong
            government commitments, and the organizational competency of
            implementing agencies are factors which minimize the
            unexpected risks resulting from innovations in institutional
            development. However, the difficulties experienced with the
            introduction of improved planning, and management
            techniques, convey the need for both capacity building, and
            understanding of local conditions. This holds true for
            procurement issues as well, exemplified by long delays,
            particularly regarding the traffic signaling system's procurement.
